title: Candid Health and AppliedAI Secure Significant Funding to Enhance Medical Billing and AI Automation
summary:
- Candid Health raised $52.5 million in Series C funding, led by Oak HC/FT and existing investors.
- This funding follows a $29 million Series B round raised six months earlier.
- The company aims to simplify medical billing by automating claims submissions and reducing manual work.
- Candid Health's revenue grew nearly 250% in 2024, illustrating its rapid growth.
- The startup utilizes a sophisticated rules engine to ensure accurate claims submissions on the first try.
- Future plans may include AI features to streamline the claims process further and avoid denial calls altogether.

- Abu Dhabi-based G42 leads a US$55 million Series A funding round for AppliedAI, a process automation startup.
- Funding contributors include Bessemer Venture Partners, Palantir, McKinsey, and Accrete Capital.
- The funds will enhance AppliedAI's team and AI tools, focusing on industries like healthcare, insurance, government, and financial services.
- AppliedAI was founded in the UK in 2021 and is now based in Abu Dhabi.
- G42, supported by Mubadala and Microsoft, aims to establish two AI centers in Abu Dhabi to promote AI technologies and training.

sources.title: Six months after raising $29M, Candid Health nabs another $52.5M to ease medical billing
AI automation firm secures $55m from Microsoft-backed G42

title: Elon Musk’s X to Pay Trump $10M; Meta Settles $25M Lawsuit Over Account Suspension
summary:
- Meta has settled a lawsuit with Donald Trump for $25 million over the suspension of his accounts after the January 6 Capitol riot.
- $22 million of the settlement will fund Trump’s presidential library, while the rest covers legal fees and other plaintiffs.
- Zuckerberg’s decision to suspend Trump’s accounts was due to perceived risks during civil unrest; Trump has since reinstated on Facebook and Instagram after a two-year suspension.
- This agreement follows a two-year suspension of Trump’s accounts due to the Capitol riot, with reinstatement occurring in 2023 under new guidelines.
- Neither Meta nor Trump’s legal teams have commented on the settlement details.
- CEO Mark Zuckerberg's past interactions with Trump are under scrutiny post-settlement.

- Elon Musk’s X to pay Donald Trump $10 million to settle a lawsuit over his 2021 ban.
- The lawsuit arose from Twitter's decision to ban Trump after the January 6 Capitol riots.
- Trump's team considered dropping the lawsuit due to his growing relationship with Musk.
- Musk reinstated Trump's account in 2022 and invested over $250 million in Trump's 2024 campaign.
- Trump decided to proceed with the settlement despite his ties with Musk; Meta previously settled a related lawsuit for $25 million.

sources.title: Meta agrees to pay Trump $25m for suspending accounts over Capitol riots
Meta settles lawsuit with Trump for $25m: sources
Elon Musk’s X will pay Trump $10M to settle lawsuit over 2021 ban

title: Saudi Tech Initiatives: Simplex Factory and Alat's Robot Exports
summary:
- Simplex has raised US$13 million for a factory in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
- The facility will span 20,000 square meters and is set to open in Q1 2026.
- This initiative aligns with Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 to localize industries and diversify the economy.
- Simplex aims to meet rising demand for CNC machines and expand its exports to 21 countries.
- Alat, a Saudi Arabian company backed by the Public Investment Fund, will start exporting industrial robots globally by May 2025.
- CEO Amit Midha announced the plan during the Private Sector Forum in Riyadh on Feb. 12.
- The robots are produced in Riyadh and aim to enhance manufacturing efficiency and reduce automation costs.
- The initiative follows a joint venture between Alat and Japan’s SoftBank Group established in February 2024.
- Alat also plans to export laptops, PCs, and servers by late 2025 through a partnership with Lenovo.
- Founded in 2024, Alat is aligned with Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030, focusing on AI integration in automation.
- The Saudi Industrial Development Fund has invested 161 billion riyals (US$42.93 billion) to strengthen local industries.

sources.title: Egypt’s Simplex raises $13m to build factory in Saudi Arabia
Saudi tech firm to export industrial robots by May 2025

title: Meta extends AI server life, cuts $2.9b in 2025 costs
summary:
- Meta Platforms extends depreciation period for AI infrastructure to 5.5 years.
- Expected reduction in depreciation expenses by $2.9 billion in 2025, nearly 4% of projected pre-tax profits.
- Increase in capital expenditures by up to 75% this year to enhance AI technologies.
- Financial impact of this change anticipated to be larger in 2026.
- CFO Susan Li cites 'efficiency gains' for the extension, similar moves made by other tech companies.
- Microsoft and Oracle have also extended their server lifespans while Amazon reduced theirs.

sources.title: Meta extends AI server life, cuts $2.9b in 2025 costs

title: Why your IoT devices are the weakest link in security
summary:
- IoT devices are projected to reach 40 billion by 2030, but face an average of 10 attacks per device daily.
- Security breaches in critical sectors like healthcare and utilities may lead to severe consequences.
- Many IoT devices lack essential security features like encryption, leading to vulnerabilities.
- Users and manufacturers share responsibility for IoT security, with manufacturers often prioritizing time-to-market.
- Regulatory frameworks are essential for enforcing security standards in IoT devices.
- AI and machine learning can enhance security by predicting and preventing threats, but require proper integration.

sources.title: Why your IoT devices are the weakest link in security

title: Latent Labs Launches with $50M to Make Biology Programmable
summary:
- Latent Labs, founded by former DeepMind scientist Simon Kohl, exits stealth with $50 million funding.
- The startup aims to build AI models to "make biology programmable" and collaborate with biotech companies to optimize proteins.
- Latent Labs aims to reduce reliance on wet labs for drug discovery and expedite research and development processes.

sources.title: Latent Labs Launches with $50M to Make Biology Programmable

title: This Valentine’s Day, don’t fall for romance scams, Meta warns
summary:
- Meta Platforms warns users about rising romance scams ahead of Valentine’s Day.
- Scammers often impersonate attractive individuals with fake backgrounds, using stolen or AI-generated photos.
- Meta collaborates with Graphika to dismantle three types of prevalent romance scams, including military impersonators and fake match-making agencies targeting individuals in Africa.
- Meta is testing facial recognition tools to identify fake profiles but currently, it's limited to celebrity impersonation.
- Users are advised to be wary of unsolicited messages and to verify identities of strangers before engaging or sending money.

sources.title: This Valentine’s Day, don’t fall for romance scams, Meta warns

title: OpenAI pledges that its models won’t censor viewpoints
summary:
- OpenAI clarifies its AI models will address sensitive topics and will not suppress any viewpoints.
- The updated Model Spec prohibits steering users towards any specific agenda, reinforcing the belief in intellectual freedom.
- This decision may be influenced by political pressures and accusations of censoring conservative viewpoints.

sources.title: OpenAI pledges that its models won’t censor viewpoints

title: VC industry reacts to Trump nominating a16z’s Brian Quintez for regulatory role
summary:
- Brian Quintenz is nominated to lead the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) by Trump.
- He has prior experience as a commissioner at the CFTC during Trump's first administration.
- His nomination has received positive reactions from various industry leaders including Brian Armstrong of Coinbase and Bobby Franklin of the NVCA.
- The CFTC is currently facing internal controversies, including staffing issues and investigations.
- Quintenz is the latest in a series of a16z affiliates taking significant roles in the Trump administration.

sources.title: VC industry reacts to Trump nominating a16z’s Brian Quintez for regulatory role

title: Elizabeth Holmes says from prison she’s ‘committed’ to ‘making healthcare solutions available to everyone’
summary:
- Elizabeth Holmes gave her first interview from prison to People magazine.
- She is committed to making affordable healthcare solutions available to everyone.
- Holmes maintains she did not commit fraud despite being found guilty of four counts of fraud in 2022 and is serving an 11.25-year sentence, reduced to nine for good behavior.
- Her former partner Sunny Balwani received a 13-year sentence for 12 charges related to fraud.

sources.title: Elizabeth Holmes says from prison she’s ‘committed’ to ‘making healthcare solutions available to everyone’

title: Meet the Bop House, the internet’s divisive new OnlyFans hype house
summary:
- The Bop House is a TikTok page featuring content creators, founded in December by Sophie Rain and Aishah Sofey.
- Composed of 8 creators aged 19-24, they have over 33 million followers collectively and generated $10 million in revenue in the first month from OnlyFans.
- The group has faced controversy due to the blend of their PG TikTok content and their adult careers, raising concerns about influencing a young audience.

sources.title: Meet the Bop House, the internet’s divisive new OnlyFans hype house

title: OpenAI cancels its o3 AI model in favor of a ‘unified’ next-gen release
summary:
- OpenAI cancels the o3 AI model, which was planned for early 2025 release, in favor of GPT-5, integrating existing technologies.
- CEO Sam Altman emphasized simplifying product offerings and ensuring AI is user-friendly.
- GPT-4.5, also known as Orion, is expected to launch soon as the last non-reasoning model before GPT-5.

sources.title: OpenAI cancels its o3 AI model in favor of a ‘unified’ next-gen release

title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
summary:
- ChatGPT, launched in November 2022 by OpenAI, has gained over 300 million weekly active users.
- In 2024, OpenAI partnered with Apple for generative AI offerings and released GPT-4o.
- OpenAI faces internal challenges including executive departures and lawsuits.
- In 2025, OpenAI is trying to maintain its position against competitors like DeepSeek and expand relationships with government and corporate sectors.
- New features and updates for ChatGPT include the integration of a unified model and enhanced user interaction options.

sources.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot

title: Apple’s TV app, TV+ streaming service, and MLS Season Pass launches on Android
summary:
- Apple TV app, including Apple TV+ and MLS Season Pass, launched on Android devices.
- Supports phones, tablets, and foldables, expanding beyond the previous Google TV version.
- Users can create an Apple account directly on their device, subscription priced at $9.99/month.
- Service launches in markets where Android is prevalent, increasing user reach.
- Features popular Apple Original shows and films, and includes offline downloads and watchlists.
- MLS Season Pass available as an add-on for $12.99/month or $79/season.
- Android app optimized using Material Design; lacks in-app Store found in Apple version.
- Rollout began on February 12, 2025, coinciding with Apple TV+'s five-year mark in the streaming arena.

sources.title: Apple’s TV app, TV+ streaming service, and MLS Season Pass launches on Android

title: Hate speech dramatically increased on X under Elon Musk’s watch, researchers say
summary:
- Hate speech on X increased by about 50% during the months of Elon Musk's CEO tenure compared to the previous period.
- The study noted rises in homophobic, transphobic, and racist slurs, along with more 'likes' on hate posts, indicating higher engagement.
- Researchers called for stronger moderation on the platform, reflecting concerns over inauthentic accounts and hate.
- Many high-profile advertisers had pulled ad spend but some, including Comcast and Apple, are considering returning as Musk's influence grows.

sources.title: Hate speech dramatically increased on X under Elon Musk’s watch, researchers say

title: Apple is reportedly exploring humanoid robots and expressive robotics with Pixar-like lamp
summary:
- Apple shares details on consumer robotics research focusing on expressive movements for better human-robot interaction.
- A prototype lamp mimics Pixar’s Luxo Jr., demonstrating movements that convey attention and intention.
- The lamp responds to queries using Siri, indicating alignment with Apple’s smart home strategy, though still in research phase with no confirmed products.
- Apple is investigating humanoid and non-humanoid robots according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo.
- A recently published research paper explores human interactions with non-anthropomorphic robots.
- Kuo projects that mass production of robots may not occur until 2028 due to current developmental challenges.
- Apple is reportedly more focused on user perception and sensing technologies than just humanoid designs.
- The company is in the exploratory phase and could potentially integrate robots into a smart home ecosystem.
- Research published by Apple aimed to attract engineers in a competitive job market for robotics.

sources.title: Apple explores expressive robotics with Pixar-like lamp
Apple is reportedly exploring humanoid robots

title: Google expands Family Link parental controls with screen time tools, approved contacts, and more
summary:
- Google announced updates to its parental control software, Google Family Link.
- New features include screen time management tools and approved contacts for children.
- A ‘School Time’ option will roll out next week to limit device usage during school hours.
- Parents can restrict kids’ contacts to approved numbers starting in March.
- Kids will be able to use Google Wallet for in-store payments this spring, with parental oversight.
- Teens will gain access to AI-powered tools and features later this year.
- These updates are influenced by increasing regulations regarding minors' online safety.

sources.title: Google expands Family Link parental controls with screen time tools, approved contacts, and more

title: Defense and resilience tech reached an all-time high 10% of all VC funding in Europe
summary:
- The war in Ukraine has significantly increased interest in defense tech among European VCs.
- Dealroom's report revealed that defense, resilience, and security startups secured a record $5.2 billion in venture capital, representing 10% of all VC funding in Europe.
- Germany emerged as the top country for DSR funding in Europe in 2024, followed by the U.K. and France, with notable investments in dual-use technologies.

sources.title: Defense and resilience tech reached an all-time high 10% of all VC funding in Europe

title: Meta in Talks to Acquire AI Chip Firm FuriosaAI
summary:
- Meta is reportedly negotiating to acquire FuriosaAI, a South Korean AI chip startup founded by former Samsung and AMD engineers.
- The acquisition aims to enhance Meta's AI hardware capabilities, particularly for its text-generating models like Llama 2 and Llama 3.
- FuriosaAI has raised approximately $61.94 million and is engaged with potential customers in the U.S., Japan, and India.
- This move is seen as a strategy for Meta to decrease dependency on Nvidia, as it plans to invest up to $65 billion in AI initiatives in 2025.

sources.title: Meta in Talks to Acquire AI Chip Firm FuriosaAI

title: May Mobility launches its first driverless commercial ride-hail service
summary:
- May Mobility launched its first fully driverless commercial service in Peachtree Corners, Georgia, on February 12, 2025.
- The service follows a 'gentle onramp' approach by offering on-demand shuttles along uncomplicated routes instead of individual ride-hail.
- This marks May's third driverless deployment in the U.S., after launches in Sun City, Arizona, and Ann Arbor, Michigan.
- The Peachtree Corners service includes eight pre-set stops and operates on a dedicated 3-mile autonomous vehicle track with advanced connectivity features.
- Combined with a public launch, the shuttle service operates Monday to Friday from 9:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. with a capacity of up to five passengers per vehicle.

sources.title: May Mobility launches its first driverless commercial ride-hail service

title: ‘I will never recover from this’: The internet is spiraling over the Duolingo owl’s untimely death
summary:
- Duo, the Duolingo owl, is pronounced dead by Duolingo in a humorous post.
- The cause of death is unknown, but the company joked he "probably died waiting for you to do your lesson."
- Duolingo capitalized on the situation by promoting its premium service, Duolingo Max.
- Dua Lipa acknowledged the news with a humorous post on X.
- Duolingo updated its profile picture to honor Duo, and TikTok featured a somber video of Duo's fictional funeral.
- Duo transformed from a simple mascot to a meme icon over time, joining the ranks of other fallen corporate mascots.

sources.title: ‘I will never recover from this’: The internet is spiraling over the Duolingo owl’s untimely death

title: This Week in AI: Musk bids for OpenAI
summary:
- Elon Musk offered to buy OpenAI’s governing nonprofit for $97.4 billion.
- OpenAI CEO Sam Altman humorously rejected the offer, referencing a previous Twitter acquisition.
- Musk's bid comes amid OpenAI's plans to convert to a for-profit structure, complicating their process.
- OpenAI's board may view Musk’s offer as a hostile takeover or question his funding.
- OpenAI’s counsel stated the nonprofit is not for sale and is valued at much more than Musk's bid.
- Musk’s ongoing lawsuits against OpenAI add tension to the situation.

sources.title: This Week in AI: Musk bids for OpenAI

title: Watch these Google DeepMind robots play a game of soccer
summary:
- Researchers at Google DeepMind demonstrated miniature humanoid robots playing a one-on-one game of soccer.
- The robots were trained to learn movement skills such as walking, kicking, and recovering from falls.
- They developed an understanding of soccer rules, enabling them to anticipate ball movement and block shots.

sources.title: Watch these Google DeepMind robots play a game of soccer

title: Security compliance firm Drata acquires SafeBase for $250M
summary:
- Drata has acquired SafeBase, a software security review startup, for $250 million.
- SafeBase's co-founders will retain their roles and continue to offer a standalone product.
- The acquisition aims to enhance trust management solutions amid increasing demand and regulatory pressures in security compliance.

sources.title: Security compliance firm Drata acquires SafeBase for $250M

title: Las Vegas just got a Netflix restaurant
summary:
- Netflix Bites restaurant has opened in the MGM Grand Hotel & Casino, offering dishes inspired by Netflix shows.
- The restaurant serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner, featuring items like a Bridgerton-inspired tea service and Stranger Wings.
- This is not Netflix's first food venture; a similar pop-up existed in LA in 2023, but the new location is a year-long residency aimed at reaching a broader audience.

sources.title: Las Vegas just got a Netflix restaurant

title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei Critiques AI Regulation Efforts and Warns of AI Advancement Risks
summary:
- Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic, criticized the AI Action Summit in Paris as a 'missed opportunity' for decisive regulatory actions.
- He acknowledged the French government's efforts but stressed urgency in addressing AI's rapid advancements.
- Amodei raised concerns about potential security risks from advanced AI systems, advocating for greater transparency in governance.
- He contrasted his views with OpenAI's positive outlook on the summit's impact on responsible AI development.
- Emphasized the importance of equitable distribution of AI benefits across society.
- Discussed the 'race' to enhance AI models and highlighted the significance of understanding AI developments.
- Advocated safety in AI governance, pointing out changes since the Bletchley Summit.
- Dismissed inaccuracies regarding DeepSeek’s model training costs and expressed geopolitical concerns.
- Teased upcoming reasoning-capable models from Anthropic to enhance performance.
- Noted potential industry disruptions and partnerships in sectors like pharma to leverage AI efficiencies.

sources.title: Dario Amodei Critiques AI Action Summit as a Missed Opportunity
Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warns of ‘race’ to understand AI as it becomes more powerful

title: Trump’s firing of the U.S. government archivist is far worse than it might seem
summary:
- On February 7, Trump fired Colleen Shogan, the Archivist of the United States, marking the first such dismissal since the 1930s.
- Shogan stated she was given no cause for her firing and expressed pride in her service.
- Trump's dismissal of Shogan is linked to her agency's role in informing the DOJ about his alleged mishandling of classified documents.
- Reports suggest Trump has a list of other NARA officials he plans to dismiss in retaliation.
- The role of NARA is critical for the preservation of democratic processes including administering the Electoral College and managing document classifications.

sources.title: Trump’s firing of the U.S. government archivist is far worse than it might seem

title: VC Sheel Mohnot talks about Twitter fame, fintech, and the truth about AI startups
summary:
- Sheel Mohnot co-founded Better Tomorrow Ventures (BTV), focusing on pre-seed and seed stage fintech investments.
- His social media presence has gained over 150,000 followers on X, with posts that often diverge from venture capital topics.
- BTV has raised $300 million and invested in notable fintech startups such as AngelList and Unit.
- Mohnot's viral posts contributed to his social media strategy, enhancing his appeal to founders and potential deals.
- He anticipates a resurgence in the fintech market and emphasizes opportunities in vertical SaaS and B2B marketplaces.

sources.title: VC Sheel Mohnot talks about Twitter fame, fintech, and the truth about AI startups

title: SEC and Binance Request 60-Day Pause in Legal Battle
summary:
- Binance and the US SEC requested a 60-day pause in their legal case due to a new cryptocurrency task force.
- The SEC filed a lawsuit against Binance for trading volume inflation and fund mismanagement in June 2023.
- The newly launched SEC crypto task force aims to address regulatory challenges and potentially help resolve the case.
- The SEC is seeking a 60-day pause in its lawsuit against Binance to adopt a more crypto-friendly approach under new leadership.
- The joint motion was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia, indicating potential changes in the agency's strategy.
- The SEC's lawsuit against Binance, filed two years ago, garnered significant attention for allegations of deception from the company's founder Changpeng Zhao.

sources.title: Binance, US SEC request 60-day pause in legal battle
SEC and Binance request 60-day pause in lawsuit as the agency shifts to be more crypto-friendly

title: SoftBank reveals $2.4 billion loss in Q3
summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp. reported a 369.2 billion yen ($2.4 billion) loss for fiscal Q3.
- This is in contrast to a 950 billion yen profit during the same quarter last year.
- Quarterly sales rose 3% year-on-year to 1.83 trillion yen ($11.9 billion).
- The report follows a recent AI investment announcement of up to $500 billion in a project called Stargate.
- For the nine months of the fiscal year, SoftBank recorded a profit of 636 billion yen ($4 billion), a significant improvement from a loss of 459 billion the previous year.
- Investment gains came from companies like Alibaba, Coupang, and Grab Holdings; however, some gains were reversed in the latest quarter.

sources.title: SoftBank reveals $2.4 billion loss in Q3

title: Trump picks Apple exec to lead transportation safety agency
summary:
- President Trump nominated Jonathan Morrison, an Apple executive, to head the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
- The Senate Committee on Commerce, Science and Transportation will review the nomination.
- Morrison previously served as chief counsel for NHTSA and has automotive industry experience.

sources.title: Trump picks Apple exec to lead transportation safety agency

title: Suger helps companies list and scale up on cloud marketplaces
summary:
- Suger automates SaaS product listing across various cloud marketplaces, helping companies scale with reduced engineering overhead.
- The company launched in late 2022 and has grown to over 200 customers, including Snowflake and Intel.
- Recently raised $15 million in Series A funding, aiming to enhance product capabilities and engineering resources.

sources.title: Suger helps companies list and scale up on cloud marketplaces

title: Top of the flops: just what does the games industry deem ‘success’ any more?
summary:
- Square Enix labeled the 2013 Tomb Raider reboot, which sold 3.4 million copies in the first month, a disappointment due to unmet sales expectations.
- EA's CEO reported that Dragon Age: The Veilguard, launched in October 2024, reached 1.5 million players but did not resonate widely, leading to claims of it being a failure.
- Despite the perception of failure, 1.5 million players is a respectable number compared to sales of other RPGs in similar release periods.
- The unrealistic expectations for new games lead to significant consequences for developers like BioWare, which has seen drastic staffing reductions following the release of Dragon Age.

sources.title: Top of the flops: just what does the games industry deem ‘success’ any more?

title: Following Google, Apple’s maps now show Trump’s Gulf of Mexico name change
summary:
- Apple renamed the Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America on its maps following a presidential order.
- The name change was officially made by the U.S. Geographic Names Information System.
- Google previously announced it would update its maps to reflect the name change, applying different names depending on the geographical location of the user.
- Microsoft has also updated the name on its Bing maps.
- The Associated Press continues to use the historical name, Gulf of Mexico, while recognizing the new designation.

sources.title: Following Google, Apple’s maps now show Trump’s Gulf of Mexico name change

title: SGNL snags $30M for a new take on ID security based on zero-standing privileges
summary:
- SGNL has developed a new approach to identity security based on zero-standing privilege, which allows conditional user access rather than permanent access.
- The startup announced a $30 million Series A funding led by Brightmind Partners, with participation from Microsoft and Cisco Investments.
- SGNL has raised a total of $42 million and claims to have multiple major enterprise customers using its access management solutions.
- The founders, Scott Kriz and Erik Gustavson, previously co-founded Bitium, which was acquired by Google in 2017.
- The technology aims to address vulnerabilities in identity management seen in high-profile breaches such as those at MGM and T-Mobile.

sources.title: SGNL snags $30M for a new take on ID security based on zero-standing privileges

title: Singapore’s IMDA creates leadership role for genAI
summary:
- Singapore's Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) has established a new leadership role focused on generative artificial intelligence (genAI).
- The role involves developing and integrating genAI solutions across IMDA, including strategizing, managing teams, and ensuring ethical governance.
- Candidates should have 10 years of experience in AI or machine learning, with at least five years in leadership roles, and must possess technical expertise in machine learning frameworks.

sources.title: Singapore’s IMDA creates leadership role for genAI

title: SpotDraft taps AI to help streamline contract management
summary:
- 79% of legal firms utilized some form of AI for casework in 2024, up from 19% in 2023.
- SpotDraft, founded in 2017, offers contract automation solutions and has around 400 customers.
- CEO Shashank Bijapur sees 2025 as a pivotal year for advancing AI in their offerings.
- SpotDraft raised $54 million in a Series B round, bringing total funding to over $80 million for R&D and market expansion.
- The legaltech sector saw $2.6 billion in VC funding in 2024, rebounding from a low of under $1 billion in 2023.

sources.title: SpotDraft taps AI to help streamline contract management

title: Adobe launches subscriptions for Firefly AI
summary:
- Adobe launches a standalone subscription service for its Firefly AI models for image, vector, and video generation.
- The Standard plan costs $9.99/month with unlimited access to AI image/vector features and 2,000 credits for video generation.
- The Pro plan costs $29.99/month, offering credits for generating 70 five-second AI videos.
- New Firefly video model allows users to create AI-generated videos using text or images.
- A Premium tier is expected to be released, allowing creation of 500 AI videos monthly.
- Competitors include OpenAI's Sora and Google DeepMind's Veo, with Firefly uniquely trained on licensed content.

sources.title: Adobe launches subscriptions for Firefly AI

title: AI-driven manufacturing database Keychain raises $5M for European push
summary:
- Keychain is an AI-powered platform that connects the CPG industry with over 30,000 manufacturers and 20,000 brands.
- The company raised $5 million led by Continente, Portugal's largest retailer.
- Founders previously created Handy, acquired by ANGI Homeservices.
- Keychain aims to streamline sourcing processes for packaging materials and ingredients.
- The platform currently helps submit over a billion dollars in projects and plans to launch in Europe later this year.
- Since November 2023, Keychain has raised a total of $38 million from various venture firms and CPG giants.
- Keychain is launching two new platforms focused on packaging and ingredients.

sources.title: AI-driven manufacturing database Keychain raises $5M for European push

title: Lanch bags $27M for a social media-skewed take on fast food
summary:
- Lanch raised €26 million ($27 million) in a Series A round led by Felix and HV Capital to expand its food brand business.
- The startup focuses on developing food brands through social media and influencer engagement, and it plans to expand first in Germany before entering new markets.
- Lanch has developed brands like Loco Chicken and Happy Slice Pizza, and has also launched its first packaged product, Happy Chips.
- Since its launch 18 months ago, Lanch has appeared in 350 ghost kitchens and achieved notable sales successes, including selling 30,000 pizzas in one weekend.
- Lanch aims to create a presence similar to large franchises like Raising Cane’s or Chick-fil-A, and its potato chips are now available in over 10,000 supermarkets.

sources.title: Lanch bags $27M for a social media-skewed take on fast food

title: Chestnut Carbon Secures $160M for Reforestation Initiatives and Microsoft's Carbon Credit Agreement
summary:
- Microsoft announced a 25-year deal to purchase over 7 million tons of carbon credits from [Chestnut Carbon](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=chestnut%20carbon).
- The deal supports reforestation of [60,000 acres](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=reforestation) across Arkansas, Louisiana, and Texas.
- Chestnut Carbon raised $160 million in Series B financing to convert marginal farmland into forests.
- The funding aims to expand carbon credit capacity to 100 million metric tons by 2030.
- Mast Reforestation raised $25 million for wildfire restoration efforts through biomass burial.
- Microsoft’s emissions increased by 29% since 2020, highlighting the need for carbon credit solutions.
- The reforestation projects could generate significant carbon credits, with Mast's initiative estimated at 30,000 metric tons.
- Over 100 organizations signed an [open letter](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/06/orgs-demand-action-to-mitigate-ais-environmental-harm/) urging action against AI's environmental impact.
- Demand for carbon credits remains high among tech companies aiming to offset emissions from data centers.

sources.title: Microsoft signs massive carbon credit deal with reforestation startup Chestnut Carbon
Orgs demand action to mitigate AI’s environmental harm
Mast Reforestation hatched a plan to restore wildfire-ravaged forests. Investors took notice.
Chestnut Carbon gets $160M to turn old farms into forests

title: ChatGPT’s latest feature is a transformative leap for web research
summary:
- OpenAI announced a new ChatGPT feature called “deep research,” which enhances the chatbot's ability to provide substance in responses.
- The feature is currently available to ChatGPT Pro users for $200/month and is expected to reach ChatGPT Plus users soon.
- Deep research functions by consulting real-time sources online, generating detailed and well-researched responses with citations, although it still shows weaknesses in critical analysis and factual updates.
- Users reported positive experiences with many types of queries, though the feature struggled with paywalled sites and certain complex requests.

sources.title: ChatGPT’s latest feature is a transformative leap for web research

title: The Hidden Costs of Facebook's Content Moderation: A Personal Account
summary:
- Sonia Kgomo shares her experiences as a content moderator for Facebook through the subcontractor Sama, highlighting the psychological toll of viewing graphic content.
- Many moderators face impossible quotas and lack mental health support, leading to widespread trauma and anxiety.
- A class action lawsuit is underway in Kenya against Sama and Facebook, revealing systemic issues in outsourcing digital labor.
- There is a growing movement, African Tech Workers Rising, advocating for better wages and working conditions for tech workers.
- Calls for professional standards and protections for content moderators include the establishment of unions and improved mental health resources.

sources.title: The Hidden Costs of Facebook's Content Moderation: A Personal Account

title: EU abandons ePrivacy, AI liability reforms as bloc shifts focus to AI competitiveness
summary:
- The EU Commission has officially withdrawn the ePrivacy Regulation proposal due to a lack of agreement among co-legislators.
- This move is part of the Commission's 2025 work program, citing no foreseeable agreement and the proposal being outdated in light of recent technological and legislative changes.
- The ePrivacy Directive aims to strengthen online privacy protections, but years of lobbying from tech giants like Google and Amazon stalled its progress.
- Other significant changes include the withdrawal of the AI Liability Directive, which aimed to update product safety rules for AI technology.
- The Commission is now focusing on fostering AI competitiveness, with plans for an Innovation Act and Cloud and AI Development Act among its legislative priorities.

sources.title: EU abandons ePrivacy, AI liability reforms as bloc shifts focus to AI competitiveness

title: No-code app builder Softr expands beyond Airtable databases
summary:

- Softr features a drag-and-drop interface for building applications and introduces AI tools to assist users in app development, alongside a new permission system for data access control.
- In addition to current capabilities, Softr plans to add workflows and tables in the future to enhance app-building functionalities.
- The platform has over 600,000 signups, with around 5,000 paying customers, and operates on a freemium model with no dedicated sales team, leading to nearly profitable status for the company.

title: Apple Chips Vulnerabilities Allow Data Leak from Browsers
summary:
- Apple-designed chips in Macs, iPhones, and iPads have two vulnerabilities leaking sensitive data from Chrome and Safari.  
- Vulnerabilities enable side channel attacks via speculative execution optimizations, affecting A- and M-series chip sets.  
- The more significant attack, FLOP, can read sensitive data like location history and credit card info from targeted sites.  
- SLAP is limited to reading adjacent strings from another webpage.  
- Affected devices include recent Mac laptops, desktops, iPads, and iPhones since 2021.  
- Researchers suggest potential mitigations and await patch plans from Apple, although Apple claims there's no immediate risk.

sources.title: Apple Chips Vulnerabilities Allow Data Leak from Browsers

title: Google Ends Diversity Hiring Goals and Removes Cultural Events from Calendar
summary:
- Google eliminates its diversity hiring targets and will review its DEI programs.
- This decision follows a trend among tech companies to roll back DEI initiatives amid criticism from conservative groups.
- DEI targets introduced in 2009 aimed for a 30% increase in underrepresented hires by 2020.
- Google's 2024 diversity report shows minimal change in leadership demographics, with 5.7% Black and 7.5% Latino representation.
- Reconsideration of diversity report publication and adaptation of programs due to legal changes is underway.
- Google's SEC filing omits previous commitments to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
- Other companies, like Meta and Amazon, have also ended DEI programs amid similar pressures.
- Pinterest identifies DEI attacks as potential business risks in its [latest 10-K filing](https://d18rn0p25nwr6d.cloudfront.net/CIK-0001506293/973659c6-d9a4-483b-a151-22b4a2a5bd9e.pdf).
- Insufficient or excessive DEI efforts could harm talent acquisition and brand reputation.
- Target faced backlash and a lawsuit for not disclosing DEI risks, affecting its stock price.
- Google removed cultural events like Black History Month and Pride Month from the default calendar in mid-2024.
- Other events removed include Jewish Heritage, Indigenous Peoples Month, Holocaust Remembrance Day, and Hispanic Heritage Month.
- Users can still add other important moments manually to their calendars despite these removals.

sources.title: Google ditches DEI hiring goals

title: Authorities Arrest Four Suspected [8base Ransomware](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=8base) Operators Amid Global Takdown Campaign
summary:
- Ransomware payments fell by over a third to $813 million in 2024, down from $1.25 billion in 2023.
- Major incidents included attacks on NHS trusts and Krispy Kreme.
- Decline attributed to victims refusing to pay and intensified law enforcement actions against [cybercriminals](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=cybercrime).
- Total payments for 2024 are lower than previous years, below 2020's $999 million and 2019's $1.1 billion.
- Expert Jacqueline Burns Koven suggests this indicates averted 'ransomware apocalypse' due to effective collaboration and victim resistance.
- Despite the decline, ransomware attacks are still frequent, with rising demands from cyber gangs.
- UK ministers are considering a ban on ransomware payments by public entities, proposing mandatory reporting of such payments.
- Payments dropped more than 35% in 2024, with hacker demands 53% higher than actual payments in the second half of the year.
- Law enforcement efforts successfully targeted major ransomware groups like BlackCat and Lockbit in 2024, contributing to payment declines.
- International law enforcement agencies seized the 8base ransomware gang's dark web leak site.
- The operation involved agencies from Europe, Japan, U.S., and U.K., coordinated by the Bavarian State Criminal Police.
- 8base is linked to RansomHouse and employs double-extortion tactics, demanding ransom while threatening to expose sensitive info.
- The group targeted multiple sectors, especially healthcare, and was linked to a cyberattack on the United Nations Development Programme.
- The takedown message was confirmed by the U.K.'s National Crime Agency.
- A global operation arrested four Russian nationals linked to over 1,000 ransomware attacks.
- The operation, named “Phobos Aetor,” occurred in Phuket, Thailand, targeting the 8base ransomware group.
- The suspects are accused of amassing $16 million through ransomware attacks on 17 organizations in Switzerland.
- Over 40 pieces of evidence have been seized and more than 100 servers linked to the criminal network were taken down.
- The FBI warned that Phobos ransomware targeted critical infrastructure in the U.S.
- Charges were unsealed against two suspects, Roman Berezhnoy and Egor Nikolaevich Glebov, for operating the 8base affiliate organization.

sources.title: Global ransomware payments plunge by a third amid crackdown
Ransomware payments dropped in 2024 as victims refused to pay hackers

title: Major Cyberattack Affects Millions of Patients and Data in US Healthcare System
summary:
- UnitedHealth confirmed a ransomware attack on Change Healthcare impacted around **190 million people** in the U.S., marking it as the largest medical data breach in history.
- The attack occurred in February 2024, leading to significant healthcare system disruptions and compromising personal and medical data.
- The **ALPHV ransomware gang** used stolen credentials to facilitate the breach, which lacked multi-factor authentication.
- Key dates include:
  - February 21, 2024: Network shut down initiated to combat cyber intruders.
  - February 29, 2024: ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang identified.
  - March 3-5, 2024: UnitedHealth paid $22 million ransom without receiving the stolen data back.
  - June 20, 2024: Affected individuals notified as required by HIPAA.
  - July 29, 2024: Confirmation letters sent to individuals about the compromised data.
- Community Health Center reported sensitive data theft of over 1 million patients, detected on January 2, 2025, with unauthorized access starting on October 14, 2024.
- Ascension experienced a cyberattack affecting 5.6 million individuals' sensitive data.
- The attack disrupted operations in May, compromising data including names, medical information, payment details, insurance information, and government identification numbers.
- Services were mostly restored by mid-June after transitioning to manual processes due to the attack.

title: Spyware Targeting Journalists and Activists in Italy Raises Privacy Concerns

- Yambio is critical of Italy's migrant pact with Libya and contributes to [ICC](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=icc) evidence collection.
- On November 13, Yambio was notified of a mercenary spyware attack potentially aimed at him.

title: Backdoor Infecting VPNs Uses Stealthy Magic Packets for Attacks
summary:
- Ivanti VPN networks are under active attack exploiting the critical vulnerability [CVE-2025-0282](https://arstechnica.com/security/2025/01/ivanti-vpn-users-are-getting-hacked-by-actors-exploiting-a-critical-vulnerability/).
- This vulnerability allows complete control over network-connected devices with no authentication required.
- A security patch was released, upgrading Connect Secure devices to version 22.7R2.5.
- Attackers exploit this vulnerability to install new malware packages, DRYHOOK and PHASEJAM.
- PHASEJAM creates a web shell for remote access and simulates the upgrade process to deceive administrators.
- SPAWNANT malware is also used to disable Ivanti's integrity checker for device files.
- Researchers revealed a new backdoor, J-Magic, affecting enterprise VPNs using Juniper's Junos OS.
- The backdoor remains dormant until it receives a 'magic packet', which includes a challenge encrypted with an RSA key.
- J-Magic only exists in memory, making it harder to detect and has been identified in 36 organizations' networks.

sources.title: Ongoing attacks on Ivanti VPNs install a ton of sneaky, well-written malware
Backdoor infecting VPNs used “magic packets” for stealth and security

title: Is AI making us dumb?
summary:
- Researchers from Microsoft and Carnegie Mellon University published a study on the effects of generative AI on critical thinking skills.
- The paper warns that overreliance on AI may deteriorate cognitive faculties by shifting focus from higher-order thinking to verification of AI outputs.
- In a study of 319 participants using AI weekly, 36% reported utilizing critical thinking skills to counter AI shortcomings.
- Participants often verified AI outputs with external sources, undermining the AI's utility.
- Confident users of AI tended to use less critical thinking than those confident in their own abilities.
- Researchers suggest that while AI tools don't make users dumber, they can weaken problem-solving capacity if abused.

title: UK Government Orders Apple to Create iCloud Backdoor for Encrypted Data Access
summary:
- The UK government secretly ordered Apple to create a backdoor for accessing users' encrypted iCloud data.
- The demand was made in January under the UK's Investigatory Powers Act 2016, requesting blanket access to all encrypted files.
- Apple may stop offering its encrypted cloud storage, Advanced Data Protection, to UK users due to this demand.
- A technical capability notice under the Investigatory Powers Act requires Apple to assist law enforcement globally.
- Apple's Advanced Data Protection service utilizes end-to-end encryption, meaning only account holders can decrypt files.
- Apple has stated it would refuse to build a backdoor and withdraw security features from the UK market instead.
- The UK government’s demand may lead to conflicts with EU data-sharing agreements.
- This move is part of a broader effort to enhance national security and public safety.
- Concerns about privacy and data security among users and technology experts are being raised in response to the demand.
- Critics fear this sets a dangerous precedent, potentially weakening security for Apple users worldwide and eroding civil liberties.

sources.title: UK government demands Apple backdoor to encrypted cloud data: report

title: AI's Impact on Inequality and Supply Chain Optimization: Highlights from Paris Summit
summary:

- The global summit in Paris discusses AI's effects on environment and inequality, attended by leaders and tech experts.

title: ByteDance releases open-source generative model VideoWorld
summary:

- The model excels in performing complex tasks such as origami folding and bow tying, demonstrating improved intuition.
- Researchers evaluated the model through scenarios including a Go game for rule learning and reasoning, as well as robot simulations for planning and manipulation, with training enhanced by video demonstrations for future frame prediction.

title: From Dogecoin to $Trump: everything you need know about the wild world of meme coins
summary:

- The market for meme coins has grown, driven by social media trends and disillusioned investors, despite the risks of losing money through schemes like 'pump and dump'.
- No regulatory framework exists, leading to potential issues for investors, as most meme coins don't have sustainable value.
- Meme coins often reference internet culture, and their phenomenon has been compared to the previous NFT bubble.
- Users may buy coins like $Trump not only for speculation but also to show support for the former president, despite concerns over conflicts of interest in trading fees.

title: Ai2's Tulu3-405B AI Model Outperforms DeepSeek and the Importance of Open Source Spirit
summary:

- The model features 405 billion parameters, trained on 256 GPUs, and is open source and freely available.
- Tulu3-405B aims to strengthen U.S. leadership in open-source AI, providing a competitive alternative to DeepSeek.
- It achieved top results in benchmarks like [PopQA](https://techcrunch.com/2025/01/30/ai2-says-its-new-ai-model-beats-one-of-deepseeks-best/) and [GSM8K](https://techcrunch.com/2025/01/30/ai2-says-its-new-ai-model-beats-one-of-deepseeks-best/), surpassing several models in its class.
- The model is available for testing via Ai2’s web app, with training code accessible on [GitHub](https://github.com/).
- The concept of 'open source' is often debated, with the Open Source Initiative (OSI) involved in validating licenses.
- Discussions focus on companies placing features behind paywalls and the transparency of development processes.
- The culture and governance of open source projects are crucial in addition to legal definitions.
- The Android Open Source Project exemplifies these concerns, particularly around Google's control and community engagement.
- Experts caution that projects owned by a single vendor may lack genuine open source attributes.
- The rising significance of open source in AI is noted, with calls for transparency in models like DeepSeek and Meta's Llama.
- Regulatory pressures, such as the EU AI Act, are reshaping definitions of open source, prompting companies to reconsider its meaning.

title: Ikea-backed Livspace names new CEO, moves HQ to India
summary:
- Livspace has appointed co-founder Ramakant Sharma as the new CEO, succeeding Anuj Srivastava, who will become chairman of the board.
- Sharma will manage daily operations while Srivastava will focus on the IPO process and strategic growth.
- Livspace is moving its headquarters from Singapore to India.
- The company has operated since 2014 and has become a unicorn after raising $180 million in a Series F funding round in 2022.
- To date, Livspace has raised over $433.38 million from notable investors including KKR & Co and Ikea.
- This leadership change follows layoffs of over 100 employees in 2023 as part of cost-cutting measures.

sources.title: Ikea-backed Livspace names new CEO, moves HQ to India

title: Meta and UNESCO Collaborate to Enhance AI for Underrepresented Languages
summary:
- Meta is partnering with UNESCO to launch the Language Technology Partner Program aimed at improving AI for speech recognition and translation.
- The program focuses on gathering speech recordings and transcriptions for underrepresented languages, requiring over 10 hours of content.
- Key partners include the government of Nunavut, which is supporting efforts for languages like Inuktut.
- An open-source machine translation benchmark has been released to evaluate language models, covering seven languages and available on Hugging Face.
- These initiatives are positioned as philanthropic, while also aiming to strengthen Meta's AI capabilities.

sources.title: Meta launches new program to improve speech and translation AI
Meta, UNESCO expand AI for underrepresented languages

title: Pinterest shares jump 20% on AI ad boost, strong Q1 forecast
summary:
- Pinterest shares surged 20% on Feb. 7, following a forecast of Q1 revenue between US$837 million to US$852 million, exceeding analyst expectations.
- Adjusted core earnings projection ranges from US$155 million to US$170 million.
- Growth driven by AI-powered advertising tools, reducing advertiser input by 50% and enhancing competitiveness.
- In Q4, Pinterest reported record revenue of US$1.15 billion due to strong advertising demand across various sectors.
- Stock historical volatility noted, with a 14% drop in November after weak projections but a 21% increase after strong results in April 2024.

sources.title: Pinterest shares jump 20% on AI ad boost, strong Q1 forecast

title: UAE to Invest Up to $52 Billion in AI Data Center in France
summary:
- UAE and France signed an agreement to invest €30 to €50 billion ($31 to 52 billion) for an AI data center in France.
- The data center will have a capacity of up to 1GW and is part of preparations for the AI Action Summit in Paris.
- France has identified 35 possible locations for new data centers and aims to attract foreign investments, especially in renewable energy.
- A consortium of French and Emirati investors, including the Emirati firm MGX, will support the project.
- The AI Action Summit will be attended by global leaders, discussing various investments and the environmental impact of AI.
- This investment follows a strategic AI partnership signed in May 2024 between France and the UAE and will be unveiled at a major investment event later this year.
- The Abu Dhabi-based MGX fund, with assets of US$100 billion, will provide initial financing and is also involved in 'Project Stargate.'
- This initiative aligns with the UAE's strategy to expand its influence through AI and data projects.

sources.title: UAE to invest billions to build AI data center in France
UAE to invest up to $52b in French AI data center

title: Canada bans DeepSeek chatbot on gov’t devices
summary:
- The Canadian federal government has banned the DeepSeek chatbot on government devices due to privacy concerns.
- The ban is a response to the app's collection and retention of sensitive personal data.
- Chief Information Officer Dominic Rochon recommended federal departments limit its use.
- Shared Services Canada has blocked the app on all devices it controls.
- This follows a similar initiative in the US regarding security risks associated with DeepSeek.
- The decision aligns with Canada's earlier move to remove TikTok from government devices over data collection issues.

sources.title: Canada bans DeepSeek chatbot on gov’t devices

title: EFishery reports 2 execs to police over fraud allegations
summary:
- EFishery reported two executives, initials G and C, to Indonesian police for fraud allegations in 2024.
- Allegations filed with Jakarta Metropolitan Police, National Police Criminal Investigation Agency, and Financial Services Authority.
- Significant financial discrepancies found: inflated profit of $16 million, actual loss of $35.4 million, and real revenues of $157 million.
- Claimed 400,000 farming partners; real number is 24,000.
- FTI Consulting appointed to address corporate governance issues amid ongoing investigation.

sources.title: EFishery reports 2 execs to police over fraud allegations

title: Tokocrypto announces new CEO amid rapid growth
summary:
- Tokocrypto appoints Calvin Kizana as new CEO, bringing startup leadership experience.
- Company reports tripling of transaction value and surpassing 4 million users in 2024.
- Offers access to over 380 tokens, staking, dollar-cost averaging, and instant buy/sell options.
- New partnership with blu by BCA Digital to enhance financial solutions.
- Focus on sustainable growth and strengthening Indonesia’s crypto ecosystem.

sources.title: Tokocrypto announces new CEO amid rapid growth

title: Ant International names new chief innovation officer
summary:
- Ant International has appointed Jiang-Ming Yang as its chief innovation officer (CIO), effective immediately.
- Yang will lead product and technology teams, focusing on payments, digitalization, and embedded finance.
- Previously served as chief product officer, contributing to several fintech solutions including Alipay+ and Antom.

sources.title: Ant International names new chief innovation officer

title: Anthropic CEO Critiques DeepSeek Amid AI Model Competition
summary:
- Alibaba introduced its upgraded AI model, Qwen 2.5-Max, claiming it surpasses [DeepSeek-V3](https://www.techinasia.com/news/alibaba-launches-upgraded-ai-model-as-deepseek-competes), GPT-4o, and Llama-3.1-405B.
- DeepSeek's rapid growth heightened competition in the AI sector, prompting major tech companies to upgrade and reduce AI prices.
- Anthropic’s CEO Dario Amodei criticized DeepSeek for generating dangerous bioweapons information during safety tests, labeling it the worst among tested models and emphasizing the need for AI safety considerations.

sources.title: Alibaba launches upgraded AI model as DeepSeek competes
Anthropic CEO says DeepSeek was ‘the worst’ on a critical bioweapons data safety test

title: Anduril in talks to raise up to $2.5B at $28B valuation
summary:
- Anduril is negotiating to raise $2.5 billion, bringing its valuation to $28 billion.
- The new funding round is expected to be led by Founders Fund, with a $1 billion investment.
- This follows a previous $1.5 billion funding round that valued Anduril at $14 billion just six months ago.
- The company's 2024 revenue reportedly doubled to $1 billion as it builds a billion-dollar weapons factory in Ohio.

sources.title: Anduril in talks to raise up to $2.5B at $28B valuation

title: Trump admin freezes EV charging program that gave Tesla millions
summary:
- The Department of Transportation has paused funding for a $5 billion EV charging infrastructure program, affecting Tesla which received at least $31 million from it.
- This decision is seen as part of Trump's effort to cut federally funded renewable energy projects.
- A letter from the new Department of Transportation leadership calls for a review of the NEVI program, halting new funding until updated guidance is released in the spring.
- The NEVI program, included in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Act, had an appropriation of $1 billion annually from 2022 to 2026.
- Experts argue this action is illegal and will disrupt state-level projects and jobs in the charging industry.

sources.title: Trump admin freezes EV charging program that gave Tesla millions

title: ‘It just didn’t go the way I planned’: Hawk Tuah girl breaks silence after crypto scandal
summary:
- Haliey Welch, known as the Hawk Tuah girl, speaks out after cryptocurrency scandal in December 2024.
- She launched $HAWK memecoin on December 4, achieving a $490 million market cap before collapsing by $440 million in 20 minutes.
- Welch describes trusting a friend in the token launch, which she regrets as her biggest mistake, and expresses sorrow for those affected.
- FaZe Banks, who previously urged her to fire her team, revealed he agreed to a podcast appearance with conditional terms regarding market manipulation and the future of $HAWK.
- A leak from Welch’s team caused the podcast episode to be canceled unexpectedly, leading to fluctuating prices for $HAWK.

sources.title: ‘It just didn’t go the way I planned’: Hawk Tuah girl breaks silence after crypto scandal

title: Shopify pushes for ‘open trade’ as Trump delays import exemption
summary:
- Shopify published a blog post advocating for ‘open trade’ amidst President Trump's delay in ending a trade exemption on certain Chinese imports.
- The company argues that policies limiting small businesses impose significant costs and disrupt supply chains.
- The de minimis rule, allowing low-cost imports to enter the U.S. without tax, is under threat, but Shopify insists it should remain to support small businesses in international trade.

sources.title: Shopify pushes for ‘open trade’ as Trump delays import exemption

title: Amazon to pay nearly $4 million for allegedly taking drivers’ tips
summary:
- Amazon will pay nearly $4 million to settle claims of taking tips from delivery drivers.
- The settlement follows a lawsuit by D.C. Attorney General Brian L. Schwalb regarding misleading information about tip usage.
- This comes four years after a $61.7 million settlement with the FTC over similar allegations.
- The lawsuit claimed Amazon changed its payment model without informing drivers or customers, affecting those in the Amazon Flex program.
- The FTC's complaint highlighted that Amazon used tips to offset its reduced wages for drivers.

sources.title: Amazon to pay nearly $4 million for allegedly taking drivers’ tips

title: Elon Musk's Young Engineers Tackle Government Efficiency with AI and Win $700K Challenge
summary:
- Thomas Shedd, former Tesla engineer, heads Technology Transformation Services with an AI-first strategy for the U.S. government.
- The initiative aims to operate like a startup, responding to a potential 50% budget cut.
- A new centralized government contract database for AI analysis is in the works.
- Luke Farritor, a 21-year-old, won the Vesuvius Challenge by decoding ancient scrolls, earning $700,000.
- Farritor plans to use his winnings to pay off his parents' mortgage and possibly start a company.
- The project encountered bureaucratic hurdles in accessing essential technology at the university.

One of Elon Musk’s young DOGE engineers explains how he won the $700K Vesuvius Challenge

title: Andrew Ng is ‘very glad’ Google dropped its AI weapons pledge
summary:
- Andrew Ng supports Google’s decision to drop its pledge not to build AI systems for weapons.
- Google deleted a 7-year-old pledge following protests related to Project Maven, which involved military contracts.
- Ng argued that American companies should assist military efforts for national security.
- Google’s decision aligns with a broader push for AI in military applications, amidst public scrutiny of its contracts with the military.

sources.title: Andrew Ng is ‘very glad’ Google dropped its AI weapons pledge

title: ‘A true victim of the Snapchat era’: Parents are resurfacing hilariously filtered baby photos from the 2010s
summary:
- Many parents are reminiscing about the mid-2010s and the prevalence of Snapchat filters in baby photos.
- TikToker @themkidzmama3 went viral for a video showcasing her daughter’s filtered baby photos, emphasizing the impact of the Snapchat filter culture.
- The video has garnered over 26.5 million views, sparking discussions about the future of photo albums and the potential for defiltering apps.

title: Tesla’s Dojo, a timeline
summary:
- Elon Musk aims for Tesla to become primarily an AI company with a focus on fully autonomous driving.
- Dojo, Tesla’s supercomputer, is crucial in training its Full Self-Driving (FSD) neural networks.
- The timeline highlights key developments from the inception of Dojo in 2019 to ongoing advancements in 2025, including major announcements and technical progress made each year.

title: UK's Antitrust Concerns: Probe into AWS and Microsoft Dominance Amid Criticism of CMA Chair Appointment
summary:
- The UK government is investigating the cloud market focusing on AWS and Microsoft dominance.
- The probe addresses competition issues and potential market abuses as part of regulatory efforts in tech.
- A coalition has expressed concerns over Doug Gurr, a former Amazon executive, becoming chair of the CMA, emphasizing the need for independence from Big Tech influence.
- Notable signatories of the open letter include companies like Yelp, DuckDuckGo, and Mozilla, advocating for fair competition regulations.

sources.title: UK launches probe into AWS, Microsoft cloud market dominance

title: Bluesky will soon let you limit replies to ‘followers only’
summary:
- Bluesky will introduce a new “followers only” setting for replies, allowing users to limit who can respond to their posts.
- Users can set their default reply settings to always limit replies to followers.
- This feature aims to differentiate Bluesky from competitors like X and Threads.
- Currently, Bluesky allows limiting replies to “Everybody,” “Nobody,” “Mentioned Users,” and “Followed Users.”
- The “followers only” option is intended to help reduce issues like “context collapse.”
- The feature was suggested by users and has been in discussion since December 2023.
- The AT Protocol supporting Bluesky will also be upgraded to help implement this feature.

sources.title: Bluesky will soon let you limit replies to ‘followers only’

title: DeepMind claims its AI performs better than International Mathematical Olympiad gold medalists
summary:
- DeepMind's AI, AlphaGeometry2, surpasses the average gold medalist in geometry problems from the International Mathematical Olympiad.
- AlphaGeometry2 solved 84% of geometry problems from the last 25 years in the IMO, achieving a score above the average of 40.9.
- The AI system employs a hybrid approach combining a neural network model with a symbolic engine for formal mathematical reasoning, generating over 300 million synthetic theorems for training.

sources.title: DeepMind claims its AI performs better than International Mathematical Olympiad gold medalists

title: Meta’s Ray-Ban smart glasses are having their Super Bowl moment
summary:
- Meta has purchased two ad spots for Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses during Super Bowl, featuring Chris Hemsworth and Chris Pratt.
- Over one million units of Ray-Ban Meta glasses have been sold in 2024, with plans for more releases.
- New versions of smart glasses are set to be introduced later this year, including a model with a small display for notifications and translations.
- Meta's glasses include features like AI assistance, photo and video capture, and voice control.
- Despite previous backlashes against smart glasses, there has been surprisingly little pushback against Ray-Ban Meta glasses so far.

sources.title: Meta’s Ray-Ban smart glasses are having their Super Bowl moment

title: Startups Face Dilemma of Partnerships and Dubai's Visarun.ai Secures $700k Funding
summary:
- Dubai-based [Visarun.ai](https://www.techinasia.com/news/dubai-based-ai-visa-platform-secures-700k-funding) has raised US$700,000 in pre-seed funding from undisclosed angel investors.
- Funding will aid in platform development and market expansion into UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, India, and China.
- Founded in 2024, Visarun.ai's Smart Visa Route system aims to reduce manual work by up to 70% in visa processing.
- The platform handles 10,000 visa applications monthly and plans to add features like AI virtual interviews and advanced document verification.
- Startups are weighing the pros and cons of partnerships versus solo operations.
- [Volvo](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/07/startups-face-the-recurring-dilemma-of-partnering-or-not/) partnered with Waabi for autonomous truck development, with pilot projects launching in Texas.
- Space startups OurSky and PlaneWave merged to focus on advanced telescopes under the name Observable Space.
- Figure AI terminated its partnership with OpenAI to create its own AI for humanoid robots.
- XOi acquired Specifx to enhance software solutions for maintenance, backed by $230 million funding.
- Failed startup Bench collapsed after burning through $135 million, resulting in bankruptcy.
- TechCrunch spotlighted companies expected to go public in 2025, including Karman and Voyager Technologies.

title: The Biggest Breach of US Government Data
summary:
- Operatives working for Elon Musk have accessed sensitive U.S. government data, affecting millions of federal employees and a $6 trillion payment system.
- Musk's advisory board, DOGE, took control of federal departments despite concerns over their security clearances and cybersecurity practices.
- The compromise is considered the largest known breach of federal data by private individuals, with questions arising about oversight and transparency in their operations.

sources.title: The biggest breach of US government data is under way
The biggest breach of US government data is under way

title: Ex-Apple engineer issues apology after lawsuit over Journal app, Vision Pro leaks is dismissed
summary:
- Former iOS engineer Andrew Aude issued an apology after a lawsuit by Apple for leaking confidential information was dismissed on February 7, 2025.
- The lawsuit accused Aude of sharing sensitive information regarding Apple products, including the Journal app and Vision Pro headset, with journalists.
- Aude acknowledged his mistake, expressing regret for leaking sensitive details and apologizing to his former colleagues for not keeping the information confidential.

sources.title: Ex-Apple engineer issues apology after lawsuit over Journal app, Vision Pro leaks is dismissed

title: DeepSeek: Everything you need to know about the AI chatbot app
summary:
- DeepSeek's chatbot rose to the top of the Apple App Store and Google Play charts recently.
- The AI lab is backed by High-Flyer Capital Management and focuses on AI-driven trading.
- In 2023, DeepSeek was established as a separate entity focused on AI tools, with strong recruitment from universities.
- The company has developed competitive models, including DeepSeek-V2 and V3, focusing on efficiency and performance.
- DeepSeek's R1 reasoning model performs comparably to OpenAI’s models on key benchmarks.
- DeepSeek faces regulatory challenges in China affecting its output and user accessibility issues in various countries.
- Microsoft's Azure AI Foundry includes DeepSeek models, despite concerns from tech firms about data risks.

title: Self Inspection raises $3M for its AI-powered vehicle inspections
summary:
- Self Inspection, founded in 2021, raised $3 million in seed funding co-led by Costanoa Ventures and DVx Ventures.
- The funding validates the AI-powered technology for vehicle inspections that streamlines operations in the $30 billion market.
- Self Inspection provides detailed PDF reports on vehicle damage, generated using AI trained on a large dataset of damaged vehicles.
- The software can integrate into existing workflows, making it accessible via smartphone web browsers without requiring a standalone app.

sources.title: Self Inspection raises $3M for its AI-powered vehicle inspections

title: Trump’s meme coin sparks more than 700 copycats posing as official crypto + Trump’s coin earns $100m in trading fees
summary:
- Entities behind Trump’s crypto coin earned close to $100 million in trading fees within two weeks of its launch on January 17.
- Estimates of trading fees generated range from $86 million to $100 million as of January 30.
- Over 200,000 wallets, primarily small traders, incurred losses while major investors profited.
- The $Trump coin, managed by various entities including CIC Digital, faces criticism for its ownership structure and potential conflicts of interest.
- Ethics experts express concerns about the mix of business and political affiliations surrounding the coin.
- Donald Trump launched a controversial meme coin before his second inauguration in January.
- More than 700 copycat meme coins have been created, many using Trump family names without official ties.
- Experts warn that investors are at risk of being deceived by these fake coins.
- The first copycat coin appeared just 29 minutes after the official announcement of the Trump coin.
- Trump's involvement in cryptocurrency has faced criticism from ethics watchdogs and economists for potential grifting.

title: Microsoft Copilot and OpenAI's Collaboration with US National Labs for Nuclear Research
summary:
- OpenAI plans to allow U.S. National Laboratories to use its AI models for nuclear weapons security and scientific projects.
- Collaboration with Microsoft to deploy a model on the supercomputer at Los Alamos National Laboratory.
- Focus on reducing the risk of nuclear war and securing nuclear materials, with researchers having security clearances involved in consultation.
- Microsoft Copilot is a suite of generative AI tools designed to enhance productivity across various Microsoft applications, including Outlook, Teams, and GitHub.
- Copilot is integrated with Microsoft’s search engine, Bing, and features stand-alone apps for iOS and Android.
- Copilot Pro costs $20/month providing enhanced features across Microsoft 365 apps like Word and Excel, while Microsoft 365 Copilot is priced at $30/user/month with enterprise-grade data protection.

sources.title: OpenAI will offer its tech to US national labs for nuclear weapons research

title: German court orders X to give data access to democracy researchers ahead of federal elections
summary:
- A Berlin regional court ruled that X must provide data to civil society organizations for research on election integrity.
- The ruling is under the EU's Digital Services Act, which mandates platforms to assist researchers studying systemic risks.
- The ruling comes as Germany prepares for federal elections, with concerns about potential election interference and the influence of social media on public debates.

sources.title: German court orders X to give data access to democracy researchers ahead of federal elections

title: VC Mike Ghaffary is looking for the job-creating AI startup that doesn’t yet exist
summary:
- VC Mike Ghaffary announces his transition from Canvas Ventures to Burst Capital.
- Ghaffary aims to support startups that create good-paying middle-class jobs amid AI-related job displacement.
- He emphasizes the need for AI solutions that provide vocational training for high-paying trades.

title: Laurene Powell Jobs joins Amazon in backing nuclear startup X-Energy in $700M round
summary:
- Nuclear startup X-Energy has raised an additional $200 million, bringing its Series C round total to $700 million.
- New investors include Laurene Powell Jobs’s Emerson Collective, Ares Management, Jane Street, and Segra Capital Management.
- X-Energy's Xe-100 reactors are expected to generate 80 megawatts of electricity each, enough to power approximately 50,000 homes.
- Reactors utilize TRISO fuel for safety, with each containing about 200,000 carbon-coated uranium particles.
- The first reactor for Amazon is expected to be operational in the early 2030s.
- Funds will be used for reactor design, licensing, and the initial phase of a fuel fabrication plant in Oak Ridge, Tennessee.

sources.title: Laurene Powell Jobs joins Amazon in backing nuclear startup X-Energy in $700M round

title: HPE begins notifying data breach victims after Russian government hack
summary:
- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has notified individuals affected by a data breach attributed to Russian hackers in 2023.
- The breach involved personal information like Social Security numbers, driver’s license information, and credit card numbers.
- The cyberattack began in May 2023 and affected HPE's email and SharePoint systems, hosted by Microsoft.
- The hackers, known as Midnight Blizzard, are linked to Russia's foreign intelligence service, SVR.
- Microsoft confirmed their network was also compromised, targeting corporate executives and cybersecurity staff.

sources.title: HPE begins notifying data breach victims after Russian government hack

title: Ilya Sutskever’s Startup in Talks for $20B Fundraising
summary:
- Safe Superintelligence, founded by Ilya Sutskever, seeks to raise funding at a valuation of at least $20 billion as of February 7, 2025.
- It is not clear how much funding the startup is aiming for; the new valuation is four times its previous $5 billion valuation from September 2024.
- Safe Superintelligence has yet to generate revenue and has raised $1 billion to date with backing from investors like Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and DST Global.
- Sutskever is recognized for his significant contributions to AI, notably during his time at OpenAI.

sources.title: Ilya Sutskever’s Startup in Talks for $20B Fundraising

title: PromptLayer is building tools to put non-techies in the driver’s seat of AI app development
summary:
- PromptLayer is focused on building tools for non-technical users to enhance AI app development.
- The company has raised $4.8 million in a seed round led by Ivan Bercovich, with participation from several investors.
- Their platform features a 'prompt registry' for version control and testing of prompts, aimed at domain experts.
- PromptLayer has over 10,000 customers, with 13x revenue growth this year, primarily driven by word-of-mouth.

title: Parents Sue TikTok Over Alleged Child Deaths Linked to 'Blackout Challenge'
summary:

- A mother claims TikTok's algorithm exposed her daughter to dangerous videos.

title: Football Manager 25 video game cancelled after series of delays
summary:
- Sports Interactive (SI) has cancelled the 2025 release of Football Manager after multiple delays.

- SI plans to focus on future games, typically released in November, and will not update the 2024 version with 2025 squad information.

summary:

title: Shopee launches platform to help SG sellers go regional
summary:
- Shopee has launched the Shopee International Platform (SIP) in Singapore to assist local sellers in expanding into new markets.
- The initiative targets Malaysia and Thailand initially, with future plans for the Philippines.
- Over 8,000 sellers participated in the pilot, resulting in an eightfold increase in orders and gross merchandise value in three months.
- The program offers free cross-border logistics, customer service, and secure payment tools for regional expansion.
- A new feature will give high-performing sellers in Malaysia more control over product selection, pricing, and promotions.
- Shopee plans to onboard more sellers each month via an automated invitation process after the pilot's success.

title: PowerSchool Data Breach Affects 16,000 Students in the UK and Exposes Sensitive Information
summary:
- A significant data breach at PowerSchool compromised sensitive personal data for millions across North America.
- Exposed information includes Social Security numbers, medical data, and detailed student records.
- The Toronto District School Board confirmed data from all students from 1985 to 2024 was affected.
- Approximately 62 million students and 9.5 million teachers are estimated to be impacted by the December 2024 breach.
- Attackers accessed data via a compromised account lacking multi-factor authentication.
- Key institutions affected include the Toronto District School Board and Calgary Board of Education.
- Awareness of the breach began on December 28, 2024; notifications to affected individuals started on January 29, 2025.
- The exact number of affected students or specific data accessed by PowerSchool remains unconfirmed and under investigation.
- The identity of the hackers and findings from CrowdStrike’s investigation have yet to be disclosed.
- Grubhub also reported a breach linked to unauthorized access from a third-party provider, affecting customer and driver details.
- Personal details compromised at Grubhub included names and email addresses; Social Security numbers were not affected.
- PowerSchool confirmed the data breach affecting 16,000 students in the UK involved hackers accessing data via compromised customer support credentials.
- Affected data includes contact info, dates of birth, and limited medical data; four UK schools were impacted but not named.
- PowerSchool has not reported the breach to the UK Information Commissioner’s Office yet.

sources.title: Data breach hitting PowerSchool looks very, very bad
PowerSchool begins notifying students and teachers after massive data breach
What PowerSchool won’t say about its data breach affecting millions of students
Grubhub confirms data breach affecting customers and drivers
PowerSchool data breach affected 16,000 students in the UK

title: Meta’s use of pirated books for AI training exposed
summary:
- Recent unsealed emails suggest Meta used pirated books for AI training from shadow libraries.
- At least 81.7 terabytes of data were downloaded, including 35.7 terabytes from Z-Library and LibGen.
- Concerns about legal risks and use of corporate resources for pirated content were raised by an internal engineer in April 2023 and escalated by September.
- Meta allegedly used external servers and “stealth mode” to reduce traceability.
- Authors are seeking more depositions due to inconsistencies in testimonies regarding Mark Zuckerberg's involvement.
- Meta claims its actions fall under “fair use” and challenges authors’ lack of evidence of distribution through torrenting activities.

summary:
- Lyft has partnered with Anthropic to create an AI assistant for customer service inquiries.
